docs.lead_paragraph: People who smoke, have high blood pressure or are overweight would pay more for health insurance under a recommendation being debated this week by state insurance regulators. The recommendation, put before the National Association of Insurance Commissioners, would encourage health insurance companies to offer discounts to people making an effort to be healthier. ''Nonsmokers will pay less,'' said John Banzhaf, executive director of Action on Smoking and Health, which is supporting the proposal. ''Smokers will pay considerably more. This is not a penalty, but their fair share.''
